author: pk910
content:
things got worse on devnet-4. we have a massive forking party on the previous canonical chain after we bumped the blob count :/
we've lowered the blob spamming again - hoping clients agree on the 2 major chains again.

author: samcm
content:
Something to keep in mind for all clients: our Victoriametrics (prometheus) cluster was overwhelmed today from the devnet-4 load. The largest contributor was supernodes that have libp2p metrics based on `topic`. 

With BPO's every 24h on this devnet each client was generating a fresh set of libp2p metrics with every BPO. It might make sense for clients to reset those metrics at the fork epoch? I imagine we'd see this with some users on mainnet if we queue up 3 BPO's at a time too

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content: Hi, Sunnyside Labs published a fusaka-devnet-3 spec devnet report that was tested before devnet-4. We believe it can help predict fusaka-devnet-4 behavior once current issues are resolved and high-blob-load testing resumes. We hit 72 blobs/block peaks and sustained >60 blobs (10-min avg) under 60 M gas, a 1-in-4 supernode ratio, and bandwidth caps. Instability appeared when full-node uplink (~25 Mbps) saturated, causing slower propagation, more attestation disagreement, and reorgs. GetBlobsV2 performance under heavy load varied by ELs. Please find the report: https://www.notion.so/testinprod/Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-08-13-24e8fc57f54680088514eccdca62c560?source=copy_link

author: manunlp
content:
On devnet-4, are CL bootnodes healthy?
I am not able to find any correct peer if using the provided list of bootnodes.
However, If I add this ENR to the list:
```
- enr:-Ni4QBl06VXhyrctr9Wii_yZSfgSl5gyKqLoFOB6BK46DSw3d5Efc8wBVtHkioLXMd5eqvO0Ey9zxNOTEF07FSxlSoyGAZiFyfaqh2F0dG5ldHOIAADAAAAAAACDY2djCIRldGgykAsb3OhwEDgTAAUAAAAAAACCaWSCdjSCaXCEj_SAwoNuZmSEWJxiGoRxdWljgjLIiXNlY3AyNTZrMaEDIUQM0ecJBJt-jRX3Aj-E5DiQecReaXwL1Vw5hqegnV2Ic3luY25ldHMAg3RjcIIjKIN1ZHCCIyg
```

(which is `prysm-nethermind-full-1`) then I am able to sync.

author: parithosh
content: They're all using geth, and I'm resyncing the geth nodes with potential fixes. So likely they're down.

author: manunlp
content: (But no pressure at all, adding other nodes to the local bootnodes list is a good enough workaround)
